alert.note: Alert for Baker County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 1:44PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Payette, southwestern Gem, southwestern Washington, southeastern Baker and northeastern Malheur Counties through 330 PM MDT/230 PM PDT/... At 243 PM MDT/143 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Indian Head Mountain to 6 miles southeast of Letha. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weiser, Midvale, Letha, Mann Creek Guard Station, Annex, Sweedes Landing, Mann Creek Reservoir, Henley Basin, Presley Bridge, Star Butte, Midvale Hill and southern Brownlee Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Baker County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley
